AI Agents and the Future of Work

“Meet Your New Coworker”

Imagine a world where intelligent programs handle repetitive tasks, make decisions, and work alongside humans. That’s the promise of agentic AI — digital collaborators capable of managing customer service, payroll, coding, and much more.

“The IT department of every company will become the HR department for AI agents,” he explained. It’s not as far-fetched as it sounds. These agents are already being integrated into workflows, assisting with routine and complex tasks alike.

According to McKinsey, generative AI could automate 60 to 70 percent of activities that currently consume employees’ time, freeing them to focus on more strategic roles. On a global scale, Goldman Sachs projects generative AI could increase GDP by 7%, or $7 trillion.

Small businesses could use AI agents to scale faster, while larger organizations may find entirely new ways to innovate. At the same time, traditional roles will adapt, shifting toward creativity and problem-solving.

The Year of AI Agents

“2025 Belongs to Agents”

This year isn’t just about AI; it’s about AI agents. These systems are evolving beyond simple digital tools into collaborators capable of performing multi-step tasks and adapting to unexpected challenges.

He underscored their significance, explaining how they’re changing how we approach work, creativity, and decision-making. 2025 marks a turning point — a year when agents become integral to both business and personal applications.

A Connected, AI-Powered World

“AI Everywhere”

The future isn’t just about applying AI to specific tasks — it’s about embedding it into every aspect of life. He outlined how AI could reshape our daily routines:

And with a touch of humor, he added: “One day, they’ll realize… they’re agents too.”

This vision isn’t without challenges. Building a world where AI is effective and responsible requires collaboration, thoughtful design, and safeguards to ensure systems serve society’s best interests.

My Thought

The keynote wasn’t just a showcase of NVIDIA’s latest innovations but a call to consider how AI will reshape how we work and live. From AI agents transforming businesses to scaling laws driving smarter systems, the insights offered a vision of opportunity and progress.

As he pointed out:

“The future isn’t about replacing humans — it’s about amplifying what we can achieve together.”
